Package neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.commonphasephysicalproperties.viscosity

Class FrictionTheoryViscosityMethod

java.lang.Object
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.PhysicalPropertyMethod
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.commonphasephysicalproperties.CommonPhysicalPropertyMethod
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.commonphasephysicalproperties.viscosity.Viscosity
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.commonphasephysicalproperties.viscosity.FrictionTheoryViscosityMethod
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, ViscosityInterface, PhysicalPropertyMethodInterface, ThermodynamicConstantsInterface
public class FrictionTheoryViscosityMethod extends Viscosity implements ThermodynamicConstantsInterface
Implementation of the friction-theory viscosity model of Quiñones-Cisneros and Firoozabadi for mixtures. A Chung correlation provides the pure-component baseline while excess friction is obtained from repulsive and attractive EOS pressures.

References: Quiñones-Cisneros, R., and Firoozabadi, A. (2000). Friction theory for the viscosity of fluids. AIChE Journal, 46(4), 16–23.

Version:
Method was checked on 2.8.2001 - seems to be correct - Even Solbraa
Author:
esol
See Also:

    • setFrictionTheoryConstants

      public void setFrictionTheoryConstants(double kapac, double kaprc, double kaprrc, double[][] kapa, double[][] kapr, double kaprr)
      Allow user supplied friction-theory constants for other EOS models.
      Parameters:
      kapac - first constant set
      kaprc - second constant set
      kaprrc - third constant set
      kapa - matrix for attractive term
      kapr - matrix for repulsive term
      kaprr - constant for repulsive-repulsive term
